page.title: 06Stainton-Amenities
page.content: The area of Stainton Parish is 2,413 acres. Of this approximately 8% is used for industrial purposes with the rest utilised for agricultural and residential purposes. Development has spread along a gorge like valley. A farming community in the past, Stainton is now becoming a dormitory village for Doncaster, Rotherham and Sheffield. A mains water supply was laid in the village in 1938 and the installation of electricity to houses in 1951.Only houses built after 1969 are connected to a sewerage system. Since 1983 an average of 16 children are transported daily to the neighbouring school at Braithwell. 206 people live in the village. There are 8 farms, both arable and dairy.The houses are either stone buildings or modern bungalows made of bricks from the local quarry.
